1.Pros: She gives a very flexible schedule
1.Cons: she does not value her employees

2.Cons: paid barley over min wage as a manager. worked from 4am-noon due to what they thought would benefit my life. DRAMA. The managers even had a lot of drama. It was like high school all day long, only from people who are 20 years older than high schoolers.

3.Pros: Working with the public and being able to teach kids. Cold drinks and coffee.
3.Cons: Not family friendly when it comes to your own well being. Unable to make/schedule appointments because you are never off at time scheduled, sometimes you may be there over an hour past the scheduled time. No human resource to rely on, and when someone doesn't do something correctly they are yelled at in front of crew/public it doesn't matter. Incentives may be a free meal here and there, otherwise you get one 1/2 price meal during your work day no matter if you put in 24 hours! Lots of management turnover. Very poor training for new hires. Rules seem to change from one person to the next. If you fix or clean something that is very noticeable, good luck on receiving any star, pat on the back or thank you! Customer service is few and far between! Management and employees bad mouth others quite a bit. If you are depressed I would highly not recommend working here! Lots of cliques.....

4.Pros: Great for high school studentsExcellent fast food job experience/preparationEasy to learn
4.Cons: Very fast paced (almost overwhelming)Very tough on employeesJob pays too low for too much work
